snippet: After a blaze that killed 112 workers in Bangladesh, Walmart said a single supplier had been operating there without authorization, but records suggest there were actually two.
abstract: Documents uncovered at Tazreen garment factory in Bangladesh, where 112 workers died in fire, indicate that not one but two American apparel makers supplying goods for Walmart were using factory around time of fire; documents contradict statement from Walmart, which said single supplier had been operating at factory without authorization.
lead_paragraph: After a blaze that killed 112 workers in Bangladesh, Walmart said a single supplier had been operating there without authorization, but records suggest there were actually two.

headline.seo: Tazreen Garment Factory Used by 2nd Walmart Supplier
headline.main: Documents Reveal New Details About Walmart’s Connection to Tazreen Factory Fire
headline.print_headline: 2nd Supplier For Walmart At Factory That Burned
